title: Vote count begins in Canada snap election defined by Trump's trade war and threats
summary: Polling has indicated a tight race but put new Prime Minister Mark Carney as the favorite.

title: Coffee multinationals profit from forced labor in Brazil, NGO alleges in US complaint
summary: Starbucks, Nestlé, McDonald's and other major brands are allegedly sourcing coffee from Brazilian farms that use forms of slavery, according to the NGO Coffee Watch, which is filing a complaint in the US. In Brazil, the servitude and cruel treatment inflicted on workers remain far from eradicated.

title: Lights flicker back to life in Spain and Portugal after widespread power outages
summary: Electricity outages have crippled transport, communication and infrastructure across the Iberian Peninsula, affecting 48 million people in Spain and 10.5 million in Portugal.

title: In Iran, questions arise over explosion at the Shahid Rajaee port
summary: Following a blast on Saturday, April 26, the port on the Strait of Hormuz was still ablaze on Monday.

title: Macron sets 10-day horizon to amplify Western pressure on Russia
summary: The French president added that he believed he had 'convinced the Americans of the possibility of an escalation of threats and potentially sanctions' against Moscow.

title: 'Ne Zha 2' captures spectacular transformations of a young demon in search of identity
summary: Yu Yang's big-budget feature, which was a phenomenal success in China, impresses with its energetic direction and inventive, meticulous décors.

title: 'Trump is playing his hand impulisvely, while Xi Jinping is far more methodical'
summary: The confrontation between the US and China shows no signs of ending, even though recent statements from both sides attempt to ease tensions over tariffs, writes economist Claude Meyer.

title: Israel-Palestine: France pushes two-state solution
summary: French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot embarked on a regional tour ahead of the upcoming UN conference in June.

title: In Switzerland, gold refineries are operating at full capacity
summary: The four precious-metal processing plants in the country are experiencing high activity amidst a gold rush triggered by international instability.

title: In France, China stops at nothing to silence dissidents
summary: Le Monde, together with the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists, has investigated China's repression of the regime's opponents overseas. Intimidation, harassment of their families, and false reports to local police are some of the methods China uses to control its diaspora.

title: Conclave to elect new pope will start May 7
summary: Following the death of Pope Francis, cardinals under the age of 80 will meet in the Sistine Chapel to choose the new religious leader of the world's 1.4 billion Catholics.

title: 26 killed in Nigeria as truck drove over explosive device
summary: The attack happened in Borno state which has been a hotbed of the Boko Haram jihadist uprising in Nigeria. More than 40,000 people have died there in the past 15 years of conflict.

title: War in Ukraine: Putin announces surprise May 8-10 truce
summary: The proposed three-day ceasefire, set to coincide with the Kremlin's WWII Victory Day celebration, has come amid a crucial week for Ukraine war ceasefire negotiations, as the US considers whether to abandon the talks.

title: Trial of Kim Kardashian's 'grandpa robbers' opens in Paris
summary: Nine years after being held captive and robbed in her Paris hotel, the American reality TV star faces defendants weakened by age and illness. One has recently died.

title: Tyler, The Creator brings California flair to Paris
summary: The Los Angeles rapper, also a producer and designer, delivered an impressive solo performance on Sunday, April 27, for the first of his two concerts in the French capital.

title: French mosque murder suspect expressed desire to become a 'serial killer' in video
summary: After a three-day manhunt, Olivier A. surrendered at a police station near Florence, Italy. Investigators are focusing on a potential anti-Muslim motive but also exploring other leads. The suspect expressed on social media, both before and after his act, his intention to kill, without specifying the religion of his victims.

title: International Court of Justice holds hearings on blockage of humanitarian aid to Gaza
summary: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict will again be on the agenda of the ICJ this week. Forty countries are expected in The Hague to defend their positions on humanitarian access to Gaza, where Israel has imposed a blockade since March 2, starving the population.

title: India signs deal to purchase 26 Rafale fighter jets from France
summary: The Indian defense ministry confirmed the purchase that had been in talks for years.

title: In Mexico, 'bullfighting without violence' pleases no one
summary: In March, the Parliament approved a ban on killing bulls in the ring, much to the dismay of industry professionals as well as advocates for an outright ban on bullfighting.

title: Massive power outage throws Spain and Portugal into chaos
summary: Trains at a standstill, subways closed, road traffic paralyzed, flights canceled, communications partially cut off... The Iberian Peninsula suffered an unprecedented blackout shortly after noon on Monday. The causes have not yet been determined.

title: 'We call on the European Union to endorse a confederation of the states of Israel and Palestine in one homeland'
summary: Condemning atrocities or expressing abstract support for a 'two-state solution' is no longer sufficient, argues an international group of 121 academics and intellectuals, including Kenneth Pomeranz and Gisèle Sapiro.

title: Major maneuvers for Pope Francis's succession begin
summary: The general congregations, which started the day after Francis's death, provide an opportunity for discussions about the future of the Catholic Church. Conservatives and progressives are sizing each other up before the conclave begins, on May 7.

title: Mark Carney keeps his job as Canada's prime minister
summary: Conservative candidate Pierre Poilievre, who is often compared to Donald Trump and was predicted to win a few months ago, was penalized as a result of the US president's threats against his northern neighbor.

title: 80 years ago, French women finally voted for the first time
summary: On April 29, 1945, women in France were able to vote for the first time. Today, some centenarians remember these historic municipal elections. They emphasize that they obtained this right from the provisional government of General Charles de Gaulle in 1944 thanks to their active participation in the Resistance.

title: EU's top court rules against 'golden passport' scheme
summary: The European Court of Justice ordered Malta to terminate its program that allows wealthy individuals to acquire EU citizenship, ruling that it violated European Union law.

title: Spain's power almost fully restored, Portugal back to normal after one of Europe's most severe blackouts
summary: Questions still remain over what caused one of Europe's most severe blackouts on Monday, grounding flights, paralyzing metro systems, disrupting mobile communications and shutting down ATMs across Spain and Portugal.

title: Italian cardinal convicted of embezzlement confirms he will sit out conclave
summary: Angelo Becciu had been reportedly pushing to take part in the conclave, but, on Monday, he was presented with two documents signed by Pope Francis that told him he could not, according to Italian media.

title: Watch: Spain, Portugal hit by massive power outage
summary: Monday's massive power outage put the two countries at a standstill. Questions still remain over what caused one of Europe's most severe blackouts.
